claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A flowchart determining influenza vaccination dosing in children: it asks if the child received ≥2 doses of trivalent or quadrivalent influenza vaccine before July 1, 2022 and then directs to either 1 dose of 2022–23 influenza vaccine (if yes) or 2 doses of 2022–23 influenza vaccine ≥4 weeks apart (if no or unknown). The figure provides a dosing algorithm for pediatric influenza vaccination and contains no information on cell- or egg-based vaccine production, mutations, or their impact on effectiveness, so it does not support the claim.
